verses.verse: Then Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%>,
If we try <S%H5254><s%> to talk <S%H1697><s%> with you <S%H3811><s%>, will you be grieved? but who can <S%H3201><s%> withhold <S%H6113><s%> himself from speaking <S%H4405><s%>?
Behold <S%H3256><s%>, you have instructed many <S%H7227><s%>, and you have strengthened <S%H2388><s%> the weak <S%H7504><s%> hands <S%H3027><s%>.
Your words <S%H4405><s%> have upheld <S%H6965><s%> him that was falling <S%H3782><s%>, and you have strengthened <S%H553><s%> the feeble <S%H3766><s%> knees <S%H1290><s%>.
But now it is come <S%H935><s%> upon you <S%H3811><s%>, and you faint; it touches <S%H5060><s%> you <S%H926><s%>, and you are troubled.
Is not this your fear <S%H3374><s%>, your confidence <S%H3690><s%>, your hope <S%H8615><s%>, and the uprightness <S%H8537><s%> of your ways <S%H1870><s%>?
Remember <S%H2142><s%>, I pray you <S%H6><s%>, who ever perished, being innocent <S%H5355><s%>? or where <S%H375><s%> were the righteous <S%H3477><s%> cut off <S%H3582><s%>?
Even as I have seen <S%H7200><s%>, they that plow <S%H2790><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%>, and sow <S%H2232><s%> wickedness <S%H5999><s%>, reap the same <S%H7114><s%>.
By the blast <S%H5397><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> they perish <S%H6><s%>, and by the breath <S%H7307><s%> of his nostrils <S%H639><s%> are they consumed <S%H3615><s%>.

The roaring <S%H7581><s%> of the lion <S%H738><s%>, and the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the fierce lion <S%H7826><s%>, and the teeth <S%H8127><s%> of the young lions <S%H3715><s%>, are broken <S%H5421><s%>.
The old lion <S%H3918><s%> perishes <S%H6><s%> for lack <S%H1097><s%> of prey <S%H2964><s%>, and the stout lion <S%H3833><s%>'s whelps <S%H1121><s%> are scattered abroad <S%H6504><s%>.
Now a thing <S%H1697><s%> was secretly brought <S%H1589><s%> to me <S%H241><s%>, and my ear received <S%H3947><s%> a whisper there <S%H8102><s%>.
In thoughts <S%H5587><s%> from the visions <S%H2384><s%> of the night <S%H3915><s%>, when deep sleep <S%H8639><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> on men <S%H582><s%>,
Fear <S%H6343><s%> came <S%H7122><s%> upon me <S%H7461><s%>, and trembling, which made all <S%H7230><s%> my bones <S%H6106><s%> to shake <S%H6342><s%>.
Then a spirit <S%H7307><s%> passed <S%H2498><s%> before my face <S%H6440><s%>; the hair <S%H8185><s%> of my flesh <S%H1320><s%> stood up <S%H5568><s%>:

It stood still <S%H5975><s%>, but I could not discern <S%H5234><s%> the form <S%H4758><s%> there <S%H8544><s%>: an image was before my eyes <S%H5869><s%>, there was silence <S%H1827><s%>, and I heard <S%H8085><s%> a voice <S%H6963><s%>, saying,
Shall mortal man <S%H582><s%> be more just <S%H6663><s%> than God <S%H433><s%>? shall a man <S%H1397><s%> be more pure <S%H2891><s%> than his maker <S%H6213><s%>?
Behold <S%H539><s%>, he put no trust in his servants <S%H5650><s%>; and his angels <S%H4397><s%> he charged <S%H7760><s%> with wickedness <S%H8417><s%>:

How much less <S%H637><s%> in them that live <S%H7931><s%> in houses <S%H1004><s%> of clay <S%H2563><s%>, whose foundation <S%H3247><s%> is in the dust <S%H6083><s%>, which are crushed <S%H1792><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the moth <S%H6211><s%>?
They are destroyed <S%H3807><s%> from morning <S%H1242><s%> to evening <S%H6153><s%>: they perish <S%H6><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%> without any regarding it <S%H7760><s%>.
Does not their excellency <S%H3499><s%> which is in them go away <S%H5265><s%>? they die <S%H4191><s%>, even without wisdom <S%H2451><s%>.
